intro: Lagenocypsela papuana, commonly known as the Papuan lagenocypsela, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in coastal and sandy soils, thriving in tropical and subtropical climates. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, hard seeds. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
